tweets.text: From this drone pic, you really get a sense of the huge volume of floodwater we‚Äôre dealing with at #Malton, thanks to everyone involved in the major pumping still ongoing to keep everyone safe @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthYorksFire @northyorkscc @RyedaleDC https://t.co/IfK1wLilUU

Unloading after over a week on the road battling the rain and snow. @SonTekYSI M9 & @ARCboat have collected some record data that helped issue @EnvAgencyMids flood warnings & will improve @FloodForecasts for next time #teamEA @DefraGovUK https://t.co/jG3ltcSCfZ

Some examples of our recent #nfm #slowtheflow interventions above Staveley for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW Pleased to see evidence that they are performing well. #LakeDistrict #naturebasedsolutions #naturalcapital https://t.co/WGbm4fG1jw

tweets.text:
Last week, heavy rainfall from #StormChristoph caused #flooding across England.

Our staff have been working around the clock to keep the public and their homes safe.

There are still #FloodWarnings in place, so check your local flood risk now: https://t.co/X4IQl2YjjH https://t.co/YWbK4V6l3t

.@Guardian claims many homes & businesses are at risk of flooding due to ‚Äòruined assets‚Äô, but our blog explains more. 38,000 properties protected during #StormChristoph, no properties flooded due failed permanent defences & all assets winter ready. https://t.co/nB5wHJCW6i

tweets.text: @StHelensEnviro @agricontract @EnvAgency Not to my knowledge. But I‚Äôve only read news articles so I could be wrong. It was a ‚Äúbeauty spot‚Äù but not an sssi.

This is the 4th consecutive day we have had notification of sewage discharges into the River Chess. I am guessing but I am expecting the @EnvAgency will count this as one event. Most likely these events will go on until May or even June. https://t.co/V047hbwDMw

tweets.text:
Linda,

Thanks for your kind words. Yes, a big job, but thousands and thousands of properties protected. 

Grateful to other agencies, and public using our free-and-easy flood alerts system, never more needed than last week: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn
#floodaware 
Take care! Peter https://t.co/ea06NYDsXY
@GavinTabinerEA @EnvAgencyYNE @johncurtinEA @JamesBevanEA @OliverHarmarEA Thanks guys, you are the only reason we can sleep in Ryther!

Ongoing environmental vandalism being carried out by @TfL contactors along the Met Line trackside this January.

tweets.text: @Rosewood_Farm @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency @JanetHughes TBF 20 years ago these channels were well maintained by the NRA as it was then, little and often (ev 4-5yrs in our case) worked for drainage and minimised harm to the environment. Now a lot of waterways are fantastic habitats but inefficient waterways 1/2

tweets.text: @essexwindyfarm @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency @JanetHughes Plenty of farmers are expecting to shift increased volumes off their land more quickly and then complaining that the EA aren't doing anything. More drainage means less space for on farm storage. That needs to change. They can't keep passing the problem on.

@GavinTabinerEA @EnvAgencyYNE @johncurtinEA @JamesBevanEA @OliverHarmarEA A massive big thanks to the EA Team from Ryther and surrounding villages. Amazing support over the past week to keep us flood free. Special mention for the 3 Dan‚Äôs, Big Chris, Kate, Ash, Michael and Roger and everyone else we‚Äôve missed for all their efforts. Greatly appreciated.
@agricontract @EnvAgency It's worth mentioning that the Dutch have also been pioneering in their Catchment scale approach to water. The Room for the River project https://t.co/5bgaNtHS6R
@hortijames @agricontract @EnvAgency It was an SSSI wasn't it?
It‚Äôs that simple @EnvAgency https://t.co/ngXHA3MLDm

@Rosewood_Farm @powell_peter @cutlerstom @NrtSam @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency I'm planning pipes every 8 metres between agroforestry.. head scratching about how to reverse it or store I like the permanent sub surface they are doing in Germany. With strip or no till you could have permanent drip pipe at 100mm deep if ctf.

@TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency Unless you live and work on those floodplains and then you might feel dredging is an helpful tool

tweets.text: @agricontract @EnvAgency Completely agree, the environmentalists (arm chair theorists) will never look for solutions just blame. Look at the farmer who was slated for dredging a stretch of river that kept flooding. He solved the problem not the EA

@powell_peter @cutlerstom @NrtSam @hslyfarms @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency And when it comes to delivering biodiversity benefits, getting both permanent and temporary water onto farms is a cheap way to deliver this. Big floods on the floodplain in winter aren't as good for wildlife and more sustained flow through the year.
I'm very happy to let you all know that from April I will be going the @EnvAgency as a Senior Hydrologist in the Flood Hydrology Improvement team! #TeamEA https://t.co/GvqMKB0Vt2

tweets.text: @cutlerstom @powell_peter @NrtSam @hslyfarms @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency We've been talking a lot this afternoon about pumped drainage - I don't see the sense in pumping it out to sea when we could pump it into above ground resevoirs and at least get something out of all the fuel used to pump.

I‚Äôve spent today on the ground checking our #pumps & #defences are working as they‚Äôre designed.

This is the rather picturesque view at Wistow, Selby where our @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installed 3 #uHVP‚Äôs.

Still lots of water about but levels dropping nicely across #Yorkshire https://t.co/Ptm7XrqCcI
@hslyfarms @NrtSam @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Do you mean an automated field drain outlet to release or store water George?

@agricontract @EnvAgency This used to be one in a hundred years flood but since front gardens are parked cars and quicker housing drainage the river now comes up in 6 hours not 3 days #RiverDove https://t.co/Z7RAQ5qxey
@agricontract @EnvAgency A dredged river moves water faster. Which is great except for the people downstream.  It needs planning on a catchment scale, with areas of flood storage planned out.

We spoke to @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd about the simple steps you can take to protect yourself from flooding.

Sign up for flood alerts here: https://t.co/KuIjpLKutU https://t.co/YKXL8pGzxf

@powell_peter @cutlerstom @NrtSam @hslyfarms @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency I think when you say 'flood defences' most people immediately think of huge banks near the sea or rivers, rather than lots of small ones spread out across the countryside.

tweets.text: @cutlerstom @NrtSam @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Surface water flooding is inevitable during heavy storms. We need to plan which areas will flood and put in the correct infrastructure and compensation to build resilience. Storage only needs to be for a few extra days to reduce damaging peaks downstream.
@FloodSkinner @EnvAgency Congrats Chris. Let's hope they let you play with the games still!

@agricontract @EnvAgency Adaptation and Resilience Ollie ! ü§î 
https://t.co/O1D51yrcH7

@powell_peter @NrtSam @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency I see, but that won't be viable for most arable land unless we start growing rice. If we increase SOM and infiltration, this will store more water in the soil before it goes out the drains, but should we be blocking drains at some point in the year?

@AWP_BackCountry @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @GeorgeMonbiot @CraigBennett3 Aww, I‚Äôvehavebeen on your mind . Sweet of you. 
Please don‚Äôt confuse my two degrees with your perception what a farmer should be.  Telling.

@cutlerstom @NrtSam @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Imo With climate extremes field drains are defo required.. and to be maintained. But its the next step thats missing. On farm storage and groundwater level control with telemetry control that looks at forecasts. Rented water storage.. could be a good earner one day

@RussellB1ggs @The_WMA @EnvAgencyAnglia @Ruralpay ‚Ä¢ use tracks across the contour where possible
‚Ä¢ regularly divert run-off into field margins or soak away areas to prevent build-up of run-off down
slopes
‚Ä¢ reduce numbers on high risk steep slopes particularly in the winter
‚Ä¢ rotate to avoid severe compaction.
